result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryne R. Oleson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or schooling.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Counseling.  
DNA sample. 

Defendant eligible for CIP/SAP AFTER serving 1 year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called: 8:20am. INCLUDES 14CF1078 - PLEA; 12CM1162-SAR BR2. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Kat Jackan. COURT addresses Defendant re: SAR BR 2 matter - agreement for BR 1 to handle. State recites agreement to Plea and SAR. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (poss w/intent heroin). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense. COURT ORDERS: 12CM1162  on each Cts 1 & 2 - WI State Prison - Total of 2 yrs; Initial Confinement 1 yr; Extended Supervision 1 yr, concurrent to each other. EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONDITIONS:  Counseling; AODA; Absolute Sobriety- drugs/alcohol; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school. 100 days credit. Unpaid Court Costs. COURT FURTHER ORDERS: 14CF1078- WI State Prison- Total of 8 yrs; Initial Confinement 3 yrs; Extended Supervision 5 yrs. Concurrent to 12CM1162. EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONDITIONS: Counseling; AODA; Absolute Sobriety- drugs/alcohol; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; DNA Sample & Surcharge; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge effective 1/2014.  100 days credit. Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 yr. Crt informs and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form.  COURT remands defendant to Marathon County Sheriff Dept to be transported to Dodge Correctional as reception site. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after court. Adjourned: 8:41am.
Plea hearing on March 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Regarding Discovery
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference on February 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Arraignment on January 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
